Authors: Nadezhda Psurtseva, Ivan Zmitrovich, Vera F. Malysheva
Title:
Rogersiomyces malaysianus (Cantharellales, Agaricomycetes):
notes on taxonomy and developmental morphology
Keywords:
Hyphobasidiofera, Cantharellases, culture characters,
stichobasidia, amphithallism
Abstract:
A basidiomycete fungus from Vietnam grown in a moist
chamber on bark as substrate was identified as Hyphobasidiofera
malaysiana. The isolation of this fungus into axenic culture initiated
new possibilities for investigations, namely cultural morphology, LSU
and SSU molecular phylogenies, life cycle karyology, and mating
experiments. The comparative morphological data revealed that this
species belongs in Rogersiomyces and the combination Rogersiomyces
malaysianus is proposed. Molecular studies revealed close relationships
of Rogersiomyces, Sistotrema s. lat. and Hydnum s. str. (Cantharellales,
Agaricomycetes). It was revealed that basidiospores of the fungus are
binucleate and giving rise a dikaryotic mycelium after germination. The
cultural characters and reproductive structures of this unusual
sistotremoid fungus are described. It was concluded that dikaryotization
into basidium in this fungus, its ephemeral basidiomata and
statismosporic basidia represent an adaptation to irregular, but
plentiful moistening within monsoonal climates.
